detail.content: The Business of Electronic & Dance Music: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Recorded Music Program Courses Internships News & Events Facilities Alumni Faculty Directory Recorded Music FAQs For High School Students Facebook Twitter YouTube Summer In Recorded Music Academic Advisement Resources 194 Recordings  home > Recorded Music        The Business of Electronic & Dance Music  REMU-UT.1239 Lecture 4 Credits Instructor(s): Staff The recent attention of the explosion Electronic Dance Music suggests the world of EDM is a new phenomenon and restricted to a few elite djs and producers. But the history of this segment of the music industry extends over serveral years and has grown from a specialist art form to a worldwide sound with reaches in all sectors of the music economy. This course will look at the careers of current players in the genre like David Guetta, Skrillex, Deadmau5, A-Trak and the rise in EDM focused festivals like Electric Daisy, as well the history of genre. Whether you’re a budding superstar DJ, producer or developing skills in artist management, supervision or music journalism, we will study, discuss and analyze the key elements that can create a career and/or a business venture in Electronic Dance Music. We will examine how we got here - and what might be next for the future.  The Clive Davis Institute of Recorded Music 194 Mercer Street, 5th Floor New York, NY 10012               Phone:       212 992 8400 tisch.recorded.music@nyu.edu           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs? Overview    Intended for: high school students          Program Dates: June 29 - July 10, 2015    Priority Application Deadline: April 1, 2015    Final Application Deadline: April 15, 2015    Required Student Orientation: June 28, 2015    Housing Dates: June 28 - July 11, 2015    Tuition: $2,754    Music Technology website        Program Description       The Summer Electronic Music Institute (SEMI) is designed for rising high school juniors and seniors. Students will focus on producing music and technology for improving their production skills and enabling live electronic music composition, improvisation and/or performance. Participants will collaborate with faculty and current students of the program to develop workflows, tools and techniques that expand their production and performance options beyond their existing skill set.         To broaden the scope of young electronic music producers we will engage the following topics:                         Circuit building    Production Strategies                Controller Development    Physics of Sound                Sound Design    Hearing                Improvisation with technology    Video Art                            The daily activities include morning lectures and workshops, guided and collaborative labs and minimally supervised group project and development time. The program concludes with a technology exhibition and a performance. Students will leave the program with new found skills and ideas for the future, as well as new works for their artistic and/or business portfolios. Electronic Musicians and EDM producers should apply to this program.    Costs    Below are all costs associated with the Summer Electronic Music Institute:       Tuition: $2,754    Programming Fee: $80    Application Fee: $50; nonrefundable and paid at the end of the 2015 Summer Application    Housing and Meal Plan (optional): $762 shared room with 10 meals and 30 Dining Dollars - see the Housing and Meal Plan page for more information       Please note that there are additional fees for all International Students . For information about financial aid and scholarships, see the Finances page.    Apply & Audition    If you would like to be considered for the workshop you must complete the following:       Complete a 2015 Summer Application    Submit all Audition Requirements and supplemental materials       For More Information    Check out our FAQ for more information.
